New Records: Glenn Maxwell broke the record for the fastest century in the Cricket World Cup, scoring 106 runs off 44 balls.
Australia achieved the largest margin of victory (309 runs) in an ODI match, breaking the previous record.
David Warner scored his 22nd ODI century and his sixth World Cup century, tying him for the most World Cup centuries by an Australian.
Glenn Maxwell's 106 runs was the highest score in the match.
Key Match Events: Glenn Maxwell's rapid century was the highlight of Australia's batting performance.
The Netherlands struggled with a poor total of 90 runs, leading to a significant defeat.
Adam Zampa took four crucial wickets for Australia, contributing to the win.
The match was notable for its high-scoring nature and a dominant Australian performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Maxwell expressed pride in his performance and the team's momentum after the win.
The victory improved Australia's net run rate and moved them higher in the standings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match set a new record for the largest margin of victory in World Cup history.
Australia's net run rate improved significantly after the win.
